Treatment: Rest, hydration, decongestants, antihistamines
Medicinal Composition: Paracetamol, pseudoephedrine, chlorpheniramine
Ingredients to Avoid: Caffeine, alcohol, strong fragrances
Recommended Diet: Warm fluids, vitamin C-rich foods, soup
Precautionary Measures: Wash hands regularly, avoid close contact

Treatment: Antiviral drugs, rest, fluids
Medicinal Composition: Oseltamivir, paracetamol, ibuprofen
Ingredients to Avoid: Processed foods, dairy (if causing mucus)
Recommended Diet: Broth, garlic, fruits, leafy greens
Precautionary Measures: Vaccination, hygiene, avoid crowds

Treatment: Insulin therapy, oral hypoglycemics
Medicinal Composition: Metformin, insulin, sulfonylureas
Ingredients to Avoid: Sugars, trans fats, refined carbs
Recommended Diet: Low-carb diet, whole grains, lean protein
Precautionary Measures: Monitor glucose, exercise, regular check-ups

Treatment: Lifestyle changes, antihypertensive drugs
Medicinal Composition: Amlodipine, losartan, enalapril
Ingredients to Avoid: Sodium, caffeine, alcohol
Recommended Diet: DASH diet, potassium-rich foods, low-salt meals
Precautionary Measures: Regular BP monitoring, reduce stress

Treatment: Inhaled corticosteroids, bronchodilators
Medicinal Composition: Salbutamol, budesonide, montelukast
Ingredients to Avoid: Dust, smoke, strong odors
Recommended Diet: Anti-inflammatory foods, omega-3s, vitamin D
Precautionary Measures: Avoid triggers, carry inhaler, use air purifier

Treatment: Antibiotic therapy (for bacterial), antiviral/antifungal (if applicable), oxygen therapy, fever reducers, hospitalization in severe cases
Medicinal Composition: Azithromycin, amoxicillin, ceftriaxone, levofloxacin, oseltamivir (if viral)
Ingredients to Avoid: Alcohol (interferes with antibiotics), tobacco smoke, cold air inhalants, high-fat dairy (may increase mucus)
Recommended Diet: Warm fluids (soup, tea), high-protein diet, vitamin C-rich foods (citrus, bell peppers), antioxidant-rich foods (berries, leafy greens), adequate hydration
Precautionary Measures: Get vaccinated (pneumococcal, flu), avoid smoking, maintain hygiene, rest adequately, wear a mask in polluted or crowded areas, seek early medical attention for respiratory infections

Treatment: oxygen therapy, corticosteroids, and hospitalization if needed
Medicinal Composition: Paracetamol, dexamethasone, remdesivir, favipiravir, molnupiravir, nirmatrelvir/ritonavir (Paxlovid)
Ingredients to Avoid: Alcohol (weakens immunity), high-sugar and ultra-processed foods, cold beverages, smoking products
Recommended Diet: Immune-boosting foods like citrus fruits, turmeric, ginger, garlic, lean protein,
Precautionary Measures: Wear masks in crowded places, maintain physical distancing, hand hygiene, vaccination (COVID-19 vaccines and boosters),

Treatment: Long-term antibiotic regimen (6–9 months), usually a combination of four drugs in the initial phase followed by two drugs in the continuation phase
Medicinal Composition: Isoniazid, rifampin (rifampicin), ethambutol, pyrazinamide (initial 2 months), followed by isoniazid and rifampin (next 4–7 months)
Ingredients to Avoid: Alcohol (interferes with TB drugs, especially isoniazid), tobacco, greasy/spicy foods (may irritate stomach), raw/undercooked meat (if immunity is low)
Recommended Diet: High-protein and calorie-rich diet, eggs, milk, lean meat, legumes, nuts, fruits (especially vitamin C-rich), green leafy vegetables, whole grains
Precautionary Measures: Take full course of medication without skipping, maintain good ventilation, wear a mask to prevent spread, regular follow-up with healthcare provider, isolate during active TB phase, good personal hygiene

Treatment: Symptomatic treatment: rest, fever reducers, antihistamines for itching, calamine lotion, antiviral medications in high-risk cases (e.g., adults, immunocompromised)
Medicinal Composition: Acetaminophen (paracetamol), calamine lotion, diphenhydramine (for itching), acyclovir (antiviral)
Ingredients to Avoid: Aspirin (can cause Reye’s syndrome), spicy/salty foods (can irritate mouth sores), processed sugary foods
Recommended Diet: Soft and bland foods, cold liquids, vitamin C-rich fruits (like oranges), immune-boosting foods like yogurt, honey, soups, coconut water
Precautionary Measures: Isolate infected individual until all blisters scab, avoid scratching (trim nails), wear loose clothing, maintain hygiene, vaccination (varicella vaccine) for prevention

Treatment: No specific antiviral treatment; supportive care with rest, fever control, hydration, and nutritional support; vitamin A supplements recommended, especially in children
Medicinal Composition: Paracetamol (fever), ibuprofen (inflammation), vitamin A (supplements), oral rehydration salts (ORS)
Ingredients to Avoid: Sugary snacks (weaken immunity), processed foods, spicy or fried foods (can worsen sore throat or diarrhea), caffeine
Recommended Diet: Fluids (water, ORS, coconut water), vitamin A-rich foods (carrots, spinach, sweet potatoes), fresh fruits, soft foods like porridge, soups
Precautionary Measures: Isolate infected person, maintain good hygiene, ensure vaccination (MMR: Measles, Mumps, Rubella), avoid crowded places during outbreaks, disinfect commonly touched surfaces

Treatment: Antibiotic therapy, increased fluid intake, urinary analgesics for pain relief; cranberry products may be used for prevention but not treatment
Medicinal Composition: Nitrofurantoin, trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole (TMP-SMX), ciprofloxacin, phenazopyridine (for pain)
Ingredients to Avoid: Caffeine, alcohol, spicy foods, acidic foods (tomatoes, citrus), artificial sweeteners — all can irritate the bladder
Recommended Diet: Plenty of water, cranberry juice (unsweetened), probiotics (yogurt), vitamin C-rich foods (oranges, kiwi), herbal teas (like chamomile)
Precautionary Measures: Maintain personal hygiene, urinate after intercourse, wipe front to back, avoid holding urine for long periods, wear breathable cotton underwear, avoid scented hygiene products in the genital area

Treatment: Rehydration with oral rehydration salts (ORS), rest, antiemetics (for vomiting), antidiarrheal (in some cases), antibiotics only if bacterial cause confirmed
Medicinal Composition: ORS, zinc supplements (especially in children), ondansetron (for vomiting), loperamide (for diarrhea, not for children), ciprofloxacin or metronidazole (if bacterial or parasitic)
Ingredients to Avoid: Dairy products (temporary lactose intolerance), caffeine, alcohol, spicy and oily foods, high-fiber foods, sugary drinks (can worsen diarrhea)
Recommended Diet: BRAT diet (Bananas, Rice, Applesauce, Toast), clear soups, boiled potatoes, coconut water, probiotic-rich foods like curd or yogurt (after acute phase), electrolyte drinks
Precautionary Measures: Wash hands regularly, avoid street food and contaminated water, properly cook meat and seafood, maintain kitchen hygiene, isolate if infectious, sanitize surfaces, keep hydrated

Treatment: Topical antifungal creams or ointments for mild cases; oral antifungals for moderate to severe or systemic infections; hygiene improvement and avoiding moisture buildup
Medicinal Composition: Clotrimazole, miconazole, terbinafine, fluconazole, itraconazole (oral for severe/systemic infections)
Ingredients to Avoid: Moisturizing or oily products on infected areas, tight or non-breathable clothing, perfumed or harsh soaps, sugar-rich foods (can worsen yeast overgrowth in candidiasis)
Recommended Diet: Probiotic-rich foods (yogurt, kefir), low-sugar diet, garlic (natural antifungal), fiber-rich vegetables (spinach, broccoli), lean proteins
Precautionary Measures: Keep affected area dry and clean, wear breathable cotton clothing, avoid sharing personal items (towels, shoes), complete full antifungal treatment, maintain personal hygiene, avoid walking barefoot in public showers or pools

Treatment: Avoidance of allergens, topical corticosteroids, oral antihistamines, moisturizing creams, cold compresses, and in severe cases, immunotherapy
Medicinal Composition: Hydrocortisone cream, betamethasone, cetirizine, loratadine, diphenhydramine, calamine lotion, tacrolimus (for eczema)
Ingredients to Avoid: Fragrances, parabens, sulfates, nickel, lanolin, harsh detergents, alcohol-based skincare products
Recommended Diet: Anti-inflammatory foods: fatty fish (omega-3), turmeric, green leafy vegetables, vitamin C-rich fruits (oranges, strawberries), nuts, seeds, and plenty of water
Precautionary Measures: Identify and avoid allergens (via patch testing if needed), use hypoallergenic skincare products, moisturize daily, wear breathable clothing, avoid excessive heat and sweating, keep nails trimmed to avoid scratching and infections

Treatment: Definitive treatment is surgical removal of the gallbladder (cholecystectomy); supportive care includes pain management, antibiotics (if infected), and dietary modifications pre-surgery
Medicinal Composition: Ursodeoxycholic acid (for dissolving stones in select cases), antispasmodics (e.g., hyoscine butylbromide), NSAIDs for pain (e.g., ibuprofen), antibiotics like ceftriaxone or metronidazole (if infection present)
Ingredients to Avoid: Fatty and fried foods, spicy foods, processed meat, butter, cream, egg yolks, and full-fat dairy (these trigger gallbladder attacks)
Recommended Diet: Low-fat diet, high in fiber; include leafy greens, whole grains, fruits, lean protein (e.g., skinless chicken, fish), use olive oil in moderation; drink plenty of water
Precautionary Measures: Maintain a healthy weight, eat regular meals (avoid skipping), avoid rapid weight loss, follow up with ultrasound and liver function tests, consider elective cholecystectomy to prevent complications (e.g., gallbladder rupture or bile duct blockage)

Treatment: Eradication of H. pylori (if present), acid suppression with PPIs (proton pump inhibitors), antacids for symptom relief, discontinuation of NSAIDs, lifestyle and diet changes
Medicinal Composition: Omeprazole / esomeprazole / pantoprazole (PPIs), clarithromycin + amoxicillin/metronidazole (for H. pylori triple therapy), sucralfate (mucosal protectant), antacids
Ingredients to Avoid: NSAIDs (e.g., ibuprofen, aspirin), alcohol, caffeine, spicy foods, acidic fruits (like citrus and tomatoes), carbonated drinks, smoking
Recommended Diet: Easily digestible foods like bananas, rice, boiled vegetables, oatmeal, yogurt, lean meat; foods rich in flavonoids (apples, berries, green tea), and high-fiber foods
Precautionary Measures: Complete antibiotic and PPI course (if H. pylori positive), avoid NSAIDs and smoking, eat smaller frequent meals, reduce stress, avoid lying down immediately after eating, get regular check-ups to monitor healing

Treatment: No cure, but Antiretroviral Therapy (ART) is the standard treatment to control the virus, reduce viral load, improve immune function, and prevent opportunistic infections. Lifelong adherence is critical.
Medicinal Composition: ART Medications (combination therapy),Prophylactic meds Treatment for opportunistic infections as needed (e.g., antifungals, antivirals, antibiotics) |
Ingredients to Avoid: Raw or undercooked meat, fish, or eggs (risk of infection),Alcohol and recreational drugs (interfere with ART,Excessively sugary or processed foods (weaken immunity)
Recommended Diet: High-protein diet (lean meats, eggs, legumes),Vitamin-rich foods (especially B12, A, C, D, E),Probiotics (curd/yogurt),Antioxidant-rich fruits and vegetables,Avoid food contamination and ensure hygienic food preparation
Precautionary Measures: Strict adherence to ART regimen,Regular CD4 count and viral load monitoring,Safe sex practices (use condoms),Avoid exposure to infections (good hygiene, vaccinations),Avoid sharing needles or personal items,Regular health checkups for early detection of opportunistic infections

Treatment: Antifungal medications (topical or oral) like terbinafine or itraconazole are commonly used to treat nail fungus.
Medicinal Composition: Antifungal agents such as terbinafine, ciclopirox, and amorolfine are the main active ingredients in treatments.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid using nail polishes or cosmetic products containing harsh chemicals like formaldehyde or toluene that can worsen the infection.
Recommended Diet: A balanced diet rich in probiotics, vitamins (especially biotin and vitamin E), and low in sugar supports nail health and immune defense.
Precautionary Measures: Keep nails clean and dry, avoid sharing nail clippers, wear breathable footwear, and disinfect nail tools regularly to prevent reinfection.

Treatment: Use topical retinoids, benzoyl peroxide, or oral antibiotics to reduce inflammation and bacterial growth.
Medicinal Composition: Common active ingredients include salicylic acid, benzoyl peroxide, adapalene, and clindamycin.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid heavy oils, comedogenic skincare products, and harsh irritants like alcohol-based toners.
Recommended Diet: A low-glycemic diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and omega-3 fatty acids helps reduce acne severity.
Precautionary Measures: Maintain gentle skin hygiene, avoid excessive scrubbing, and refrain from picking or squeezing pimples to prevent scarring.

Treatment: Use pain relievers, triptans, and preventive medications like beta-blockers or anticonvulsants to manage migraines.
Medicinal Composition: Common drugs include sumatriptan, ibuprofen, ergotamine, and propranolol.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid caffeine, alcohol, aged cheeses, and foods with MSG or nitrates that can trigger migraines.
Recommended Diet: Maintain regular meals with hydration, magnesium-rich foods, and avoid known dietary triggers.
Precautionary Measures: Manage stress, maintain consistent sleep patterns, avoid bright lights and loud noises, and keep a migraine diary to identify triggers.

Treatment: Use pain relievers, muscle relaxants, physical therapy, and sometimes corticosteroid injections to relieve symptoms.
Medicinal Composition: Common medications include NSAIDs like ibuprofen, muscle relaxants, and sometimes neuropathic pain agents like gabapentin.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid excessive caffeine and inflammatory foods that may worsen pain and inflammation.
Recommended Diet: A balanced diet rich in calcium, vitamin D, and anti-inflammatory foods supports bone and joint health.
Precautionary Measures: Maintain good posture, avoid repetitive neck strain, do regular neck exercises, and use ergonomic furniture to prevent progression.

Treatment: Physical therapy, occupational therapy, and medications to manage symptoms and improve mobility are commonly used.
Medicinal Composition: Muscle relaxants, anticoagulants, and neuroprotective agents like baclofen and corticosteroids may be prescribed.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid alcohol, sedatives, and any substances that can worsen neurological function or interact negatively with medications.
Recommended Diet: A nutrient-rich diet with vitamins B12, D, antioxidants, and adequate protein supports nerve health and recovery.
Precautionary Measures: Prevent injury, manage underlying causes, maintain proper body positioning, and follow rehabilitation protocols to avoid complications

Treatment: Treat the underlying cause with medications, hydration, and sometimes phototherapy or surgery if needed.
Medicinal Composition: Depending on cause, may include antiviral drugs, steroids, or bile acid binders.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid alcohol, fatty foods, and hepatotoxic drugs that can worsen liver function.
Recommended Diet: Eat a light, balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and adequate fluids to support liver health.
Precautionary Measures: Maintain good hygiene, avoid sharing personal items, and manage underlying liver conditions to prevent worsening.

Treatment: Use antimalarial drugs like chloroquine, artemisinin-based combination therapies (ACTs), or quinine to eliminate the parasite.
Medicinal Composition: Common medications include artemether-lumefantrine, chloroquine, mefloquine, and primaquine.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid untreated water and insect bites; avoid self-medicating with ineffective or counterfeit drugs.
Recommended Diet: Maintain a nutritious diet with plenty of fluids, iron-rich foods, and vitamins to support recovery.
Precautionary Measures: Use insecticide-treated mosquito nets, apply repellents, eliminate standing water, and take prophylactic antimalarials when traveling to endemic areas.

Treatment: Supportive care with hydration, fever reducers like acetaminophen, and close monitoring for complications is essential.
Medicinal Composition: No specific antiviral drugs; treatment focuses on fluids, acetaminophen, and sometimes platelet transfusions in severe cases.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid NSAIDs like aspirin and ibuprofen to reduce bleeding risk.
Recommended Diet: Eat light, nutritious meals rich in fluids, fruits, and easily digestible foods to support recovery.
Precautionary Measures: Use mosquito repellents, eliminate stagnant water, wear protective clothing, and use mosquito nets to prevent bites.

Treatment: Use prescribed antibiotics like ciprofloxacin or azithromycin to eradicate the Salmonella bacteria.
Medicinal Composition: Common antibiotics include ciprofloxacin, azithromycin, and ceftriaxone.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid raw or undercooked foods, unpasteurized dairy, and contaminated water to prevent worsening infection.
Recommended Diet: Eat easily digestible, hygienic, and nutrient-rich foods with plenty of fluids to aid recovery.
Precautionary Measures: Practice good sanitation, drink safe water, wash hands frequently, and get vaccinated in endemic areas.

Treatment: Supportive care with rest, hydration, and avoidance of liver-stressing substances until recovery.
Medicinal Composition: No specific antiviral drugs; treatment focuses on symptom relief and liver support.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid alcohol, fatty foods, and hepatotoxic medications to protect the liver.
Recommended Diet: Consume a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and fluids to support liver healing.
Precautionary Measures: Practice good hygiene, avoid contaminated food and water, and get vaccinated to prevent infection.

Treatment: Antiviral medications like tenofovir or entecavir are used to control the virus and prevent liver damage.
Medicinal Composition: Common drugs include tenofovir, entecavir, and pegylated interferon.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid alcohol, hepatotoxic drugs, and high-fat foods to reduce liver strain.
Recommended Diet: Eat a balanced, nutrient-rich diet with plenty of fruits, vegetables, and fluids to support liver health.
Precautionary Measures: Practice safe sex, avoid sharing needles, get vaccinated, and maintain good hygiene to prevent transmission.

Treatment: Direct-acting antiviral (DAA) medications are used to cure hepatitis C in most cases.
Medicinal Composition: Common drugs include sofosbuvir, ledipasvir, velpatasvir, and glecaprevir/pibrentasvir.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid alcohol, processed foods, and liver-toxic medications to prevent further liver damage.
Recommended Diet: Follow a liver-friendly diet rich in fruits, vegetables, lean protein, and plenty of water
Precautionary Measures: Avoid sharing needles or personal items, practice safe sex, and get tested regularly if at risk to prevent spread.

Treatment: Pegylated interferon-alpha is the primary treatment, though response rates can vary.
Medicinal Composition: Pegylated interferon-alpha is the main therapeutic agent used.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid alcohol, recreational drugs, and hepatotoxic medications to prevent liver damage.
Recommended Diet: Eat a liver-friendly diet with fresh fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and adequate hydration.
Precautionary Measures: Prevent hepatitis B infection through vaccination, avoid sharing needles, and practice safe sex, as hepatitis D only occurs with hepatitis B.

Treatment: Supportive care with rest, hydration, and symptom management, as it usually resolves on its own.
Medicinal Composition: No specific antiviral; ribavirin may be used in severe or chronic cases.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid alcohol, greasy foods, and hepatotoxic substances to protect the liver.
Recommended Diet: Follow a light, nutritious diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and fluids to support liver recovery.
Precautionary Measures: Maintain good hygiene, drink safe water, avoid undercooked meat, and ensure proper sanitation to prevent infection.

Treatment: Immediate alcohol cessation, nutritional support, and corticosteroids for severe cases.
Medicinal Composition: Common medications include corticosteroids (like prednisolone) and pentoxifylline in some cases
Ingredients to Avoid: Strictly avoid all forms of alcohol and hepatotoxic drugs.
Recommended Diet: Follow a high-protein, calorie-rich, vitamin-supplemented diet to aid liver repair.
Precautionary Measures: Abstain from alcohol permanently, attend counseling or rehab if needed, and monitor liver function regularly.

Treatment: Immediate medical attention with oxygen, pain relief, clot-busting drugs, angioplasty, or surgery.
Medicinal Composition: Includes aspirin, nitroglycerin, beta-blockers, statins, and thrombolytics like alteplase.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid trans fats, excessive salt, sugar, red meat, and tobacco products.
Recommended Diet: Follow a heart-healthy diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats.
Precautionary Measures: Control blood pressure, cholesterol, and diabetes; avoid smoking; exercise regularly; and manage stress.

Treatment: Compression stockings, leg elevation, sclerotherapy, laser therapy, or surgery may be used.
Medicinal Composition: Treatments include sclerosing agents (e.g., polidocanol), venoactive drugs like diosmin, and analgesics if needed.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid high-sodium foods, processed carbs, and alcohol which can worsen swelling.
Recommended Diet: Eat a fiber-rich, low-salt diet with plenty of hydration to improve circulation and prevent constipation.
Precautionary Measures: Avoid prolonged standing or sitting, maintain healthy weight, wear compression stockings, and exercise regularly.

Treatment: Lifelong thyroid hormone replacement therapy with levothyroxine.
Medicinal Composition: Levothyroxine (synthetic T4) is the primary medication used.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid excessive soy, cruciferous vegetables (if raw), and high-iodine or high-fiber foods near medication time.
Recommended Diet: Eat a balanced diet with adequate iodine, selenium, zinc, and avoid skipping meals to support thyroid function.
Precautionary Measures: Take medication on an empty stomach, monitor TSH levels regularly, and manage stress and weight.

Treatment: Immediate intake of fast-acting carbohydrates like glucose tablets or juice, followed by a balanced snack.
Medicinal Composition: Glucose tablets, dextrose injection, or glucagon may be used in severe cases.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid alcohol, excessive caffeine, and high-sugar foods without protein or fiber to prevent spikes and crashes.
Recommended Diet: Eat small, frequent meals with complex carbs, fiber, and protein to maintain stable blood sugar levels.
Precautionary Measures: Monitor blood glucose regularly, avoid skipping meals, and adjust medication or insulin as prescribed.

Treatment: Managed with pain relievers, physical therapy, joint injections, and sometimes joint replacement surgery.
Medicinal Composition: Common medications include NSAIDs (e.g., ibuprofen), acetaminophen, corticosteroid injections, and hyaluronic acid.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid processed foods, excessive sugar, and trans fats that can worsen inflammation.
Recommended Diet: Follow an anti-inflammatory diet rich in omega-3s, antioxidants, calcium, and vitamin D.
Precautionary Measures: Maintain a healthy weight, stay physically active with joint-friendly exercises, and avoid high-impact activities.

Treatment: Managed with pain relievers, anti-inflammatory drugs, physical therapy, and sometimes disease-modifying medications.
Medicinal Composition: Includes NSAIDs, corticosteroids, DMARDs (like methotrexate), and biologics for autoimmune types.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid processed foods, refined sugars, trans fats, and excessive red meat that trigger inflammation.
Recommended Diet: Follow an anti-inflammatory diet rich in omega-3s, whole grains, fruits, vegetables, and calcium.
Precautionary Measures: Maintain a healthy weight, do low-impact exercise, protect joints, and follow medication and therapy plans consistently.

Treatment: Canalith repositioning maneuvers like the Epley maneuver effectively relieve symptoms.
Medicinal Composition: No specific medications; vestibular suppressants (e.g., meclizine) may be used temporarily for nausea.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid caffeine, alcohol, and sedatives that can worsen dizziness or imbalance.
Recommended Diet: Maintain hydration and a balanced diet to support overall nervous system health.
Precautionary Measures: Maintain hydration and a balanced diet to support overall nervous system health.

Treatment: Use topical corticosteroids, vitamin D analogs, phototherapy, and systemic immunosuppressants for severe cases.
Medicinal Composition: Common treatments include corticosteroids, calcipotriene, methotrexate, and biologics like adalimumab.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid harsh soaps, alcohol, smoking, and triggers like stress or certain medications.
Recommended Diet: Follow an anti-inflammatory diet rich in omega-3 fatty acids, fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.
Precautionary Measures: Keep skin moisturized, avoid scratching, manage stress, and follow treatment consistently to prevent flare-ups.

Treatment: Topical or oral antibiotics like mupirocin or dicloxacillin to clear bacterial infection.
Medicinal Composition: Common medications include mupirocin ointment and oral antibiotics such as cephalexin.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid sharing personal items, scratching, and using harsh soaps that irritate skin.
Recommended Diet: Maintain a balanced diet with adequate protein and vitamins to support skin healing.
Precautionary Measures: Practice good hygiene, keep affected areas clean and covered, and avoid close contact to prevent spread.

Treatment: Use topical creams, sitz baths, and minimally invasive procedures like rubber band ligation for relief.
Medicinal Composition: Common medications include hydrocortisone creams, witch hazel, and stool softeners.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid spicy foods, caffeine, and low-fiber diets that worsen constipation and irritation.
Recommended Diet: Eat a high-fiber diet with plenty of water to soften stools and prevent straining.
Precautionary Measures: Avoid prolonged sitting, practice good hygiene, and maintain regular bowel habits to prevent recurrence.

Treatment: Use topical creams, warm sitz baths, pain relievers, and in severe cases, surgical removal.
Medicinal Composition: Common agents include hydrocortisone creams, witch hazel, and analgesics like lidocaine.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid spicy foods, excessive caffeine, and low-fiber diets that worsen constipation and irritation.
Recommended Diet: Eat a high-fiber diet with plenty of water to soften stools and reduce straining.
Precautionary Measures: Avoid prolonged sitting or straining, maintain good hygiene, and exercise regularly to promote bowel health.

Treatment: Pain relief with topical anesthetics, warm sitz baths, and sometimes surgical removal of the clot.
Medicinal Composition: Use topical creams with lidocaine, hydrocortisone, and stool softeners like docusate sodium.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid spicy foods, caffeine, and low-fiber diets that worsen constipation and irritation.
Recommended Diet: Eat a high-fiber diet with plenty of fluids to soften stools and prevent straining.
Precautionary Measures: Maintain good hygiene, avoid prolonged sitting, exercise regularly, and avoid straining during bowel movements.

Treatment: Use minoxidil, finasteride, or platelet-rich plasma (PRP) therapy to stimulate hair growth.
Medicinal Composition: Common treatments include minoxidil, finasteride, biotin supplements, and corticosteroid injections.
Ingredients to Avoid: Avoid harsh chemicals, excessive heat styling, and tight hairstyles that damage hair follicles.
Recommended Diet: Eat a nutrient-rich diet with vitamins A, C, D, E, zinc, iron, and protein to support hair health.
Precautionary Measures: Maintain scalp hygiene, reduce stress, avoid smoking, and protect hair from environmental damage.
